title: 2 Euro (Astérix)

composition.text: Bimetallic: nickel brass clad nickel centre in copper-nickel ring

obverse.description: Asterix surrounded by laurels and Roman inscriptions referring to 60 years of the series. The inscription "ASTERIX" is above along with the monogram is the issuing country below. The date is at the bottom along with the mintmark and mintmaster mark. The outer ring has the 12 stars of the European flag.

reverse.description: A map, next to the face value, shows the European continent without borders.

comments:
The 300,000 copies in coincards were distributed as follows:
- 100,000 Idéfix copies
- 100,000 Obelix copies
- 100,000 Astérix copies

For 60 years, Asterix has been a true icon of the French culture. Created in 1959 by scenarist René Goscinny and cartoonist Albert Uderzo, this character embodies the Frenchman with his smartness and sharpness through the Gallic identity. Apart from its artistic line, depicting contemporary society with humour has brought Asterix great international fame for many years. Since its inception, it has been translated into all the languages of the European Union meeting a huge success. The reputation of Asterix is for example as strong in Germany as in France. It has also been very well established in the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Spain, Portugal, Italy, and Scandinavia for many years. Beyond the French icon, Asterix has become a true figure of the European 9th art.
